org.openimaj.image.feature.local.interest

Class SubPixelCorners

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.feature.local.interest.SubPixelCorners

  • public class SubPixelCorners
extends Object
    Refines detected corners (i.e. from HarrisIPD or other methods) to an optimised sub-pixel estimate. The method works by iteratively updating the sub-pixel position of a point based on the inverse of the local gradient auto-correlation matrix.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubPixelCorners

        public SubPixelCorners(int halfWidth,
               int halfHeight,
               Predicate<IterationState> iter)
        Construct with the given search window size and predicate to stop the iteration. No zeroing of weights is performed
        Parameters:
        halfWidth - half the search window width (actual size is 2*halfWidth + 1, centred on point)
        halfHeight - half the search window height (actual size is 2*halfHeight + 1, centred on point)
        iter - the predicate to stop iteration

      • SubPixelCorners

        public SubPixelCorners(int halfWidth,
               int halfHeight,
               int zeroZoneHalfWidth,
               int zeroZoneHalfHeight,
               Predicate<IterationState> iter)
        Construct with the given search window size, zeroed window and predicate to stop the iteration.

        The zeroed window is a dead region in the middle of the search zone over which the summation over gradients is not done. It is used sometimes to avoid possible singularities of the autocorrelation matrix.

        Parameters:
        halfWidth - half the search window width (actual size is 2*halfWidth + 1, centred on point)
        halfHeight - half the search window height (actual size is 2*halfHeight + 1, centred on point)
        zeroZoneHalfWidth - the half-width of the zeroed region in the weighting array
        zeroZoneHalfHeight - the half-height of the zeroed region in the weighting array
        iter - the predicate to stop iteration
